content.description: A report on a certain fast food restaurant states that <math alttext="mu" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the mean order total, is $9. The manager of the restaurant believes the mean is higher. A random sample of orders will be selected. The sample mean <math alttext="x bar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> will be calculated and used in a hypothesis test to investigate the belief.
content.question: Which of the following is the correct set of hypotheses?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0: x bar equals 9 dollars. H sub a: x bar is not equal to 9 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>≠</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: x bar equals 9 dollars. H sub a: x bar is greater than 9 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>></mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 9 dollars. H sub a: mu is not equal to 9 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>≠</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 9 dollars. H sub a: mu is greater than 9 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>></mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 9 dollars. H sub a: mu is less than 9 dollars" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
